00:00:01:210000.Scene: The stairwell. The guys are carrying kites.
00:00:01:210000.Speaker: Leonard

00:00:04:190000.Scene: The stairwell. The guys are carrying kites.
00:00:04:190000.Speaker: Howard

00:00:07:030000.Scene: The stairwell. The guys are carrying kites.
00:00:07:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:07:030000.Dialogue: Excuse me. You're misusing the word "ho."

00:00:11:060000.Scene: The stairwell. The guys are carrying kites.
00:00:11:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:11:060000.Dialogue: It's an interjection used to call attention to a destination, not an object, as in "land, ho!" or "westward, ho!"

00:00:21:050000.Scene: The stairwell. The guys are carrying kites.
00:00:21:050000.Speaker: The three guys

00:00:24:070000.Scene: The stairwell. The guys are carrying kites.
00:00:24:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:00:24:070000.Dialogue: Hey, guys. Whatcha doin'? Going out to discover electricity?

00:00:29:150000.Scene: The stairwell. The guys are carrying kites.
00:00:29:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:29:150000.Dialogue: If you're referring to the work of Benjamin Franklin, he did not "discover electricity," he merely used a kite to determine that lignining consists of electricity. He also invented the Franklin stove, bifocals and the flexible urinary catheter.

00:00:45:040000.Scene: The stairwell. The guys are carrying kites.
00:00:45:040000.Speaker: Leonard

00:00:47:200000.Scene: The stairwell. The guys are carrying kites.
00:00:47:200000.Speaker: Penny

00:00:51:020000.Scene: The stairwell. The guys are carrying kites.
00:00:51:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:51:020000.Dialogue: It's an extremely competitive, cutthroat sport.

00:00:54:210000.Scene: The stairwell. The guys are carrying kites.
00:00:54:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:54:210000.Dialogue: Actually, the risk of throat cutting is very low. On the other hand, severe string burn is a real and ever-present danger.

00:01:03:160000.Scene: The stairwell. The guys are carrying kites.
00:01:03:160000.Speaker: Leonard

00:01:05:230000.Scene: The stairwell. The guys are carrying kites.
00:01:05:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:01:05:230000.Dialogue: Gee... sounds amazing. But, I've got some friends coming over. Not a big thing... we're gonna watch the Nebraska game.

00:01:13:200000.Scene: The stairwell. The guys are carrying kites.
00:01:13:200000.Speaker: Leonard

00:01:15:110000.Scene: The stairwell. The guys are carrying kites.
00:01:15:110000.Speaker: Howard

00:01:19:020000.Scene: The stairwell. The guys are carrying kites.
00:01:19:020000.Speaker: Penny
00:01:19:020000.Dialogue: I would've invited you, but you're not a football fan.

00:01:21:120000.Scene: The stairwell. The guys are carrying kites.
00:01:21:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:21:120000.Dialogue: No, no, I'm not, so... great. You've got plans doing something you like, I've got plans doing something I like, it's good.

00:01:29:030000.Scene: The stairwell. The guys are carrying kites.
00:01:29:030000.Speaker: Penny
00:01:29:030000.Dialogue: Maybe we'll hang out later, after everybody's gone.

00:01:31:230000.Scene: The stairwell. The guys are carrying kites.
00:01:31:230000.Speaker: Leonard

00:01:33:130000.Scene: The stairwell. The guys are carrying kites.
00:01:33:130000.Speaker: Penny

00:01:38:080000.Scene: The stairwell. The guys are carrying kites.
00:01:38:080000.Speaker: Leonard

00:01:41:110000.Scene: The stairwell. The guys are carrying kites.
00:01:41:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:41:110000.Dialogue: I'm sorry, I got bored and drifted off.

00:01:46:030000.Scene: The stairwell. The guys are carrying kites.
00:01:46:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:46:030000.Dialogue: Where exactly in the interaction did the sucking lie?

00:01:50:030000.Scene: The stairwell. The guys are carrying kites.
00:01:50:030000.Speaker: Raj
00:01:50:030000.Dialogue: Leonard realized that Penny's been hiding him from her friends because he's a tiny, little man who flies kites.

00:01:57:010000.Scene: The stairwell. The guys are carrying kites.
00:01:57:010000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:02:28:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:28:120000.Dialogue: Wolowitz is trying to outflank us. Let out some string, add altitude and I'll go under and cut his line.

00:02:34:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:34:110000.Dialogue: Why wouldn't Penny want her friends to meet me?

00:02:36:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:36:160000.Dialogue: Focus, Leonard, focus! The heat of battle is upon us. The dogs of war are unleashed.

00:02:42:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:42:100000.Dialogue: Maybe Koothrappali's right. Maybe I embarrass her.

00:02:45:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:45:100000.Dialogue: You're embarrassing me. A grown man worrying about such nonsense when in the middle of flying kites.

00:02:53:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:53:230000.Dialogue: Sorry won't bring their kites down. String burn!

00:03:01:160000.Speaker: Raj
00:03:01:160000.Dialogue: They think we're flanking. They're playing right into our hands. On the count of three, we execute the flying scissor. One, two...

00:03:12:010000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:12:010000.Dialogue: That chick, she smiled at me.

00:03:17:140000.Speaker: Raj
00:03:17:140000.Dialogue: What are you doing? I can't scissors by myself!

00:03:29:210000.Speaker: Raj
00:03:29:210000.Dialogue: You're a sucky friend, you know that?

00:03:35:040000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:35:040000.Dialogue: What was I supposed to do? She gave me that "come-hit her" look.

00:03:39:050000.Speaker: Raj
00:03:39:050000.Dialogue: If she gave you any look at all, it was a "you suck" look.

00:03:44:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:44:020000.Dialogue: I would've caught up to her if I hadn't pulled a hammy.

00:03:47:020000.Speaker: Raj
00:03:47:020000.Dialogue: Please, you weigh 80 pounds. You don't have a hammy.

00:03:50:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:50:230000.Dialogue: Penny doesn't want me around her friends. I embarrass her. What else could it be?

00:03:56:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:56:050000.Dialogue: Her actions could be out of concern for your feelings. Perhaps she's excluded you from these gatherings because she's scouting for a new mate and doesn't want to do it in front of you.

00:04:09:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:09:110000.Dialogue: Agreed. Most primates don't show that sort of discretion. A female bonobo will copulate with a new male in front of the old one without so much as a "how do you do?"

00:04:19:190000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:19:190000.Dialogue: You always do this. You ditch me for a woman you don't have a shot with.

00:04:24:100000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:24:100000.Dialogue: With a woman you were chasing through a park... that's not a shot, that's a felony.

00:04:30:130000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:30:130000.Dialogue: What's worse, it cost me my prized patang fighting kite. I don't suppose there's any chance you could give me my kite back?

00:04:38:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:38:100000.Dialogue: I'm sorry, Raj, but the rules of aerial warfare dictate that the fallen kite go to the victor. And without rules, the competition has no meaning. And without meaning, the following would be an empty gesture. I have your kite. I have your kite.

00:05:05:050000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:05:050000.Dialogue: It was pretty good. We won.

00:05:07:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:07:050000.Dialogue: That's excellent. It's a weird figure of speech. "We won" when you weren't actually playing.

00:05:14:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:14:150000.Dialogue: When we watch Star Wars, we don't say, "We defeated the Empire. "

00:05:22:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:22:130000.Dialogue: On a related subject, are you embarrassed to have me around your friends?

00:05:27:170000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:27:170000.Dialogue: Oh, my god, no. Why would you ask that?

00:05:31:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:31:020000.Dialogue: You know, I just noticed I haven't really met any of them.

00:05:36:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:36:070000.Dialogue: I met the huge ex-boyfriend and the smaller yet still larger than me ex-boyfriend.

00:05:43:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:43:230000.Dialogue: By the way, were they here today? - Of course not. - Why would they be? Why would I ask? Why am I rambling? Why don't you stop me?

00:05:52:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:52:060000.Dialogue: If you want to meet my friends, that would be great. You know, I didn't want you to be bored.

00:05:57:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:57:120000.Dialogue: I wouldn't be bored. Why would I be bored?

00:06:02:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:02:230000.Dialogue: Penny, I like all sorts of people. Some of my best friends aren't geniuses.

00:06:14:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:14:080000.Dialogue: Some of my Facebook friends aren't geniuses.

00:06:17:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:17:190000.Dialogue: My point is, if we're going to be a couple, I should be friends with your friends.

00:06:22:120000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:22:120000.Dialogue: Great. Then come over next Saturday and watch the game with us.

00:06:33:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:33:170000.Dialogue: - Sure. Just I don't know much about football.

00:06:37:220000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:37:220000.Dialogue: A lot of the guys' girlfriends don't know football. They just kind of drink and talk in the kitchen.

00:06:50:230000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:06:50:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:50:230000.Dialogue: Okay, a completed pass. First down, New England.

00:06:57:160000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:06:57:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:57:160000.Dialogue: - I think I'm starting to get this.

00:07:11:050000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:07:11:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:11:050000.Dialogue: Focus on the game, not the commercials.

00:07:14:130000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:07:14:130000.Speaker: Raj
00:07:14:130000.Dialogue: Maybe if you people cut back on the beer, you could get out of the bathroom and satisfy your women without pharmaceutical help.

00:07:23:070000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:07:23:070000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:23:070000.Dialogue: Raj, what are you doing here? You were supposed to help me pimp out my Vespa.

00:07:28:100000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:07:28:100000.Speaker: Raj
00:07:28:100000.Dialogue: I'm sorry, are you under the impression that we're still friends?

00:07:32:070000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:07:32:070000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:32:070000.Dialogue: Come on. You're not still grinding on the kite thing, are you?

00:07:36:110000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:07:36:110000.Speaker: Raj
00:07:36:110000.Dialogue: It's not just the kite thing. Every time we go some place, you think you can dump me when someone prettier comes along, even though you don't have a shot with them.

00:07:43:150000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:07:43:150000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:43:150000.Dialogue: I had a shot with that jogger.

00:07:45:200000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:07:45:200000.Speaker: Raj
00:07:45:200000.Dialogue: Fine. Paint green flames on your little scooter with her.

00:07:50:130000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:07:50:130000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:50:130000.Dialogue: It's not a little scooter. It's the second biggest Vespa they make!

00:07:57:200000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:07:57:200000.Speaker: Howard

00:07:59:230000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:07:59:230000.Speaker: Leonard

00:08:03:060000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:08:03:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:03:060000.Dialogue: Now, what is this sacks statistic they put up there?

00:08:06:230000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:08:06:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:06:230000.Dialogue: All I know about Saks is my mother shops there.

00:08:12:230000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:08:12:230000.Speaker: Leonard

00:08:15:110000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:08:15:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:15:110000.Dialogue: It's football nomenclature for when a quarterback is tackled behind the line of scrimmage.

00:08:23:230000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:08:23:230000.Speaker: Leonard

00:08:26:190000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:08:26:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:26:190000.Dialogue: The line of scrimmage is the imaginary transverse line separating the offense from the defense.

00:08:35:100000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:08:35:100000.Speaker: Howard

00:08:38:040000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:08:38:040000.Speaker: Leonard

00:08:39:190000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:08:39:190000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:39:190000.Dialogue: I mean, Quidditch, sure. But football?

00:08:45:000000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:08:45:000000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:45:000000.Dialogue: Sheldon, how do you know this stuff?

00:08:47:050000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:08:47:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:47:050000.Dialogue: I grew up in Texas. Football is ubiquitous in Texas: Pro football, college football, high school football, peewee football... in fact, every form of football except the original European football.

00:08:59:070000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:08:59:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:59:070000.Dialogue: Which most Texans believe to be a commie plot.

00:09:04:010000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:09:04:010000.Speaker: Leonard

00:09:05:000000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:09:05:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:05:000000.Dialogue: If you're interested, I also know all about frying meat that isn't chicken as if it were chicken.

00:09:13:150000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:09:13:150000.Speaker: Leonard

00:09:16:070000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:09:16:070000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:09:20:050000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:09:20:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:20:050000.Dialogue: Football. I'm going to Penny's to watch a game with her friends and I don't want to look like an idiot. I want to blend in.

00:09:26:020000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:09:26:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:26:020000.Dialogue: If you want to blend in I'd think looking like an idiot would be the perfect camouflage.

00:09:31:180000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:09:31:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:31:180000.Dialogue: Come on, please teach me about football. It'll be fun.

00:09:34:100000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:09:34:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:34:100000.Dialogue: That's exactly what my father said. "Come to the games. Watch the games." Week in and week out from the time I was five until I went off to college. Longest seven years of my life.

00:09:46:210000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:09:46:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:46:210000.Dialogue: Please, I'm asking you as a friend.

00:09:50:170000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:09:50:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:50:170000.Dialogue: Are you making this a tier one friendship request?

00:09:57:180000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:09:57:180000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:09:59:030000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:09:59:030000.Speaker: Leonard

00:10:01:080000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:10:01:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:01:080000.Dialogue: All right, poindexter, sit down, shut up and listen.

00:10:06:010000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:10:06:010000.Speaker: Leonard

00:10:07:040000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:10:07:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:07:040000.Dialogue: That's how my father always began our football conversations. And if you'd like, after the game, I'll take you outside and teach you how to shoot close enough to a raccoon that it craps itself.

00:10:40:160000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:10:40:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:40:160000.Dialogue: When are you going to stop making Cylon toast?

00:10:44:080000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:10:44:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:44:080000.Dialogue: When I have enough to destroy all the human toast on the Battlestar known as Galactica.

00:10:51:110000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:10:51:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:51:110000.Dialogue: Is that what you're wearing to watch football at Penny's?

00:10:54:060000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:10:54:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:54:060000.Dialogue: - What's wrong with a football jersey?

00:11:03:070000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:11:03:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:03:070000.Dialogue: It's the smallest size they had, except the one for dogs.

00:11:08:050000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:11:08:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:08:050000.Dialogue: I can't believe they had one for dogs.

00:11:10:130000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:11:10:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:10:130000.Dialogue: Oh, yes. Canine football fans are a common sight in Texas. Cats, however, refuse to wear sporting apparel.

00:11:18:170000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:11:18:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:18:170000.Dialogue: My sister found that out the hard way.

00:11:21:230000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:11:21:230000.Speaker: Leonard

00:11:23:100000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:11:23:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:23:100000.Dialogue: Leonard, wait. Am I correct in assuming that your attempt to be accepted by Penny's peers is based on your desire to ensure your continuing mating privileges with her?

00:11:36:140000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:11:36:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:36:140000.Dialogue: Well, I wouldn't put it exactly that way.

00:11:39:030000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:11:39:030000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:11:41:170000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:11:41:170000.Speaker: Leonard

00:11:45:170000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:11:45:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:45:170000.Dialogue: Seems like an awful lot of trouble to go through for intercourse.

00:11:50:100000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:11:50:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:50:100000.Dialogue: Don't you have access to women who will do it for money?

00:11:56:140000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:11:56:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:56:140000.Dialogue: By the way, another accepted usage for the term "ho."

00:12:03:100000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:12:03:100000.Speaker: Leonard

00:12:05:200000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:12:05:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:05:200000.Dialogue: Hold on. I believe that social convention dictate you not arrive empty-handed. Would you like to bring some Cylon toast?

00:12:13:170000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:12:13:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:13:170000.Dialogue: Yeah, no, I'm trying to fit in, not get laughed at.

00:12:20:230000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard and Raj are watching a football game on the television.
00:12:20:230000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:12:28:080000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. Raj is watching a Bollywood movie. There is a knock on the door.
00:12:28:080000.Speaker: Raj

00:12:31:040000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. Raj is watching a Bollywood movie. There is a knock on the door.
00:12:31:040000.Speaker: Howard

00:12:34:090000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. Raj is watching a Bollywood movie. There is a knock on the door.
00:12:34:090000.Speaker: Raj

00:12:36:110000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. Raj is watching a Bollywood movie. There is a knock on the door.
00:12:36:110000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:36:110000.Dialogue: I brought you a little gift. New kite.

00:12:42:060000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. Raj is watching a Bollywood movie. There is a knock on the door.
00:12:42:060000.Speaker: Raj
00:12:42:060000.Dialogue: The kite you made me lose was an authentic patang, an Indian fighting kite that my brother sent to me from New Delhi. It took me a day to put together and two days to paint. This is Hello Kitty.

00:12:56:020000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. Raj is watching a Bollywood movie. There is a knock on the door.
00:12:56:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:56:020000.Dialogue: Yeah, but it comes with a little coin purse.

00:12:59:160000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. Raj is watching a Bollywood movie. There is a knock on the door.
00:12:59:160000.Speaker: Howard

00:13:02:220000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. Raj is watching a Bollywood movie. There is a knock on the door.
00:13:02:220000.Speaker: Raj
00:13:02:220000.Dialogue: You just don't get it, do you? Buying me something pretty isn't going to make our problem just go away.

00:13:10:010000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. Raj is watching a Bollywood movie. There is a knock on the door.
00:13:10:010000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:10:010000.Dialogue: Look, I admit I haven't always been the best friend I could be.

00:13:13:190000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. Raj is watching a Bollywood movie. There is a knock on the door.
00:13:13:190000.Speaker: Raj
00:13:13:190000.Dialogue: You've been a sucky friend, a sucky, sucky friend.

00:13:17:100000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. Raj is watching a Bollywood movie. There is a knock on the door.
00:13:17:100000.Speaker: Howard

00:13:26:110000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. Raj is watching a Bollywood movie. There is a knock on the door.
00:13:26:110000.Speaker: Raj

00:13:28:090000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. Raj is watching a Bollywood movie. There is a knock on the door.
00:13:28:090000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:28:090000.Dialogue: Getting shot down by the girl at Hot Dog on a Stick.

00:13:32:140000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. Raj is watching a Bollywood movie. There is a knock on the door.
00:13:32:140000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:32:140000.Dialogue: But in my defense, she was gorgeous! And working that squeezer to make the lemonade, going up and down and up and down.

00:13:40:180000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. Raj is watching a Bollywood movie. There is a knock on the door.
00:13:40:180000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:40:180000.Dialogue: It was like a free pole dance right in the middle of the food court.

00:13:45:160000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. Raj is watching a Bollywood movie. There is a knock on the door.
00:13:45:160000.Speaker: Raj

00:13:47:160000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. Raj is watching a Bollywood movie. There is a knock on the door.
00:13:47:160000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:47:160000.Dialogue: At least, I can talk to women without being drunk.

00:13:50:220000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. Raj is watching a Bollywood movie. There is a knock on the door.
00:13:50:220000.Speaker: Raj
00:13:50:220000.Dialogue: Excuse me, I have selective mutism, a recognized medical disorder. You're just a douche.

00:13:58:130000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. Raj is watching a Bollywood movie. There is a knock on the door.
00:13:58:130000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:58:130000.Dialogue: No. You know what? Maybe that's what this whole thing's about. You're not mad at me, you're mad at yourself.

00:14:04:060000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. Raj is watching a Bollywood movie. There is a knock on the door.
00:14:04:060000.Speaker: Raj
00:14:04:060000.Dialogue: No, I'm mad at you. I hate myself, but I'm mad at you.

00:14:08:170000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. Raj is watching a Bollywood movie. There is a knock on the door.
00:14:08:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:14:08:170000.Dialogue: Fine. You're mad at me. I get it. How about we go spend the day together? Just the two of us. We'll go anywhere you want.

00:14:19:130000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. Raj is watching a Bollywood movie. There is a knock on the door.
00:14:19:130000.Speaker: Raj

00:14:21:080000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. Raj is watching a Bollywood movie. There is a knock on the door.
00:14:21:080000.Speaker: Howard
00:14:21:080000.Dialogue: Come on. Let me take you someplace nice.

00:14:30:130000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. Raj is watching a Bollywood movie. There is a knock on the door.
00:14:30:130000.Speaker: Raj
00:14:30:130000.Dialogue: I do enjoy the La Brea Tar Pits.

00:14:34:130000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. Raj is watching a Bollywood movie. There is a knock on the door.
00:14:34:130000.Speaker: Howard
00:14:34:130000.Dialogue: Really, now? With the traffic and the parking? Okay, fine.

00:14:39:160000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. Raj is watching a Bollywood movie. There is a knock on the door.
00:14:39:160000.Speaker: Howard

00:14:46:160000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. Raj is watching a Bollywood movie. There is a knock on the door.
00:14:46:160000.Speaker: Raj
00:14:46:160000.Dialogue: Why can't I stay mad at you?

00:14:57:110000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Everyone is watching football.
00:14:57:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:57:110000.Dialogue: Are you people watching this? Is this amazing or what?

00:15:01:040000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Everyone is watching football.
00:15:01:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:01:040000.Dialogue: Sweetie, that's a highlight from the '98 championship game.

00:15:06:090000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Everyone is watching football.
00:15:06:090000.Speaker: Leonard

00:15:08:130000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Everyone is watching football.
00:15:08:130000.Speaker: Leonard

00:15:11:060000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Everyone is watching football.
00:15:11:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:11:060000.Dialogue: I was just hoping you were drunk.

00:15:14:100000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Everyone is watching football.
00:15:14:100000.Speaker: Penny

00:15:19:050000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Everyone is watching football.
00:15:19:050000.Speaker: Guy in baseball hat
00:15:19:050000.Dialogue: Oh, where's the flag? That's intentional grounding.

00:15:21:140000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Everyone is watching football.
00:15:21:140000.Speaker: Second guy

00:15:22:170000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Everyone is watching football.
00:15:22:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:22:170000.Dialogue: That completely was a forward pass, which they threw incomplete to avoid loss of yardage or to conserve time.

00:15:30:220000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Everyone is watching football.
00:15:30:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:30:220000.Dialogue: I can't believe they're not penalized with the loss of a down and by having to move the scrimmage line back to the spot of the foul.

00:15:41:120000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Everyone is watching football.
00:15:41:120000.Speaker: Leonard

00:15:45:020000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Everyone is watching football.
00:15:45:020000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:45:020000.Dialogue: I know. I just need you to stop talking.

00:15:54:010000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Everyone is watching football.
00:15:54:010000.Speaker: Penny

00:16:00:190000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Everyone is watching football.
00:16:00:190000.Speaker: Penny

00:16:02:170000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Everyone is watching football.
00:16:02:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:02:170000.Dialogue: You shouldn't keep it in the refrigerator. Staleness is caused by crystallization of the starch molecules, which occurs faster at cool temperatures.

00:16:09:200000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Everyone is watching football.
00:16:09:200000.Speaker: Penny

00:16:14:060000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Everyone is watching football.
00:16:14:060000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:16:16:110000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Everyone is watching football.
00:16:16:110000.Speaker: Leonard

00:16:17:160000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Everyone is watching football.
00:16:17:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:17:160000.Dialogue: You know. Mimesis. An action in which the mimic takes on the properties of a specific object or organism. Mimesis.

00:16:31:020000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Everyone is watching football.
00:16:31:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:31:020000.Dialogue: What the hell are you talking about?

00:16:34:010000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Everyone is watching football.
00:16:34:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:34:010000.Dialogue: I'm attempting to communicate with you without my meaning becoming apparent to those around you. Let me try again.

00:16:42:110000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Everyone is watching football.
00:16:42:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:42:110000.Dialogue: Have the indigenous fauna accepted you as one of their own?

00:16:48:230000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Everyone is watching football.
00:16:48:230000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:16:52:070000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Everyone is watching football.
00:16:52:070000.Speaker: Leonard

00:16:53:150000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Everyone is watching football.
00:16:53:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:53:150000.Dialogue: Good. Oh, fyi. After I eat my sandwich, I'm taking Koothrappali's patang kite out for a test run. Would you like to get your delta-wing raptor and join me? I don't want to fly kites, Sheldon. We're watching football here. I can see that. I was providing you with an alternative. A courtesy I was never offered in similar circumstances.

00:17:17:080000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Everyone is watching football.
00:17:17:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:17:080000.Dialogue: Look at that. The Oklahoma coach has thrown down a red flag, indicating he's challenging the ruling on the field. I hope he's right, 'cause if he's not, it'll cost him one of his time-outs.

00:17:32:190000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Everyone is watching football.
00:17:32:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:32:190000.Dialogue: You know, Leonard, honey, I wouldn't mind if you wanted to go fly kites with Sheldon.

00:17:38:150000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Everyone is watching football.
00:17:38:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:38:150000.Dialogue: I'll watch the end of the game. There's only three minutes left.

00:17:41:190000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Everyone is watching football.
00:17:41:190000.Speaker: Penny

00:17:43:020000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Everyone is watching football.
00:17:43:020000.Speaker: Leonard

00:17:46:010000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Everyone is watching football.
00:17:46:010000.Speaker: Leonard

00:17:49:080000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Everyone is watching football.
00:17:49:080000.Speaker: Penny

00:17:50:230000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Everyone is watching football.
00:17:50:230000.Speaker: Leonard

00:17:55:100000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Everyone is watching football.
00:17:55:100000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:55:100000.Dialogue: So, yeah, anyway, that's my boyfriend. He is really smart.

00:18:10:090000.Speaker: Raj
00:18:10:090000.Dialogue: I really like my saber-toothed cat. Thank you.

00:18:15:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:15:020000.Dialogue: Maybe after lunch, we can go to Marie Callender's and have some pie.

00:18:19:050000.Speaker: Raj
00:18:19:050000.Dialogue: I'd like that. This is turning out to be a perfect Saturday.

00:18:25:160000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:25:160000.Dialogue: Good. I'm glad. Did you see the way she smiled at me?

00:18:38:010000.Speaker: Raj
00:18:38:010000.Dialogue: If you want to chase after her, chase after her.

00:18:41:220000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:41:220000.Dialogue: Ah, who am I kidding? I wouldn't have a shot with a girl like that.

00:18:45:130000.Speaker: Raj
00:18:45:130000.Dialogue: Don't put yourself down. You're a very attractive man.

00:18:49:220000.Speaker: Raj
00:18:49:220000.Dialogue: Absolutely. It wouldn't kill you to take a Pilates class with me now and then, but you have a certain wiry appeal.

00:18:56:050000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:56:050000.Dialogue: Yeah, well, it doesn't matter 'cause she wasn't really smiling at me.
